title: Create input-output model for ICHI rewards?
body:
There are two types of votes in ICHI’s split governance model:
- ICHI votes to govern the ICHI protocol itself in exchange for governance rewards
- oneToken (ie, oneBTC) votes to govern specific oneToken instances to grow the adoption of those oneTokens

ICHI should adjust rewards to distribute new ICHI in a way that maximizes the distribution of ICHI votes (which are hard capped at 5M) and the number of oneToken votes (which are unlimited and always worth $1).

We can do that with this model:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1A7zSgrATrlmbZdZVXRdBvoZt5vDChDPWpYhOlGjc3iQ/edit?usp=sharing
author: 0x11111D16485aa71D2f2BfFBD294DCACbaE79c1d4
